thread.title: Arsenal stars call team meeting to try to fix things before biggest week of the season
thread.title_full: Arsenal stars call team meeting to try to fix things before biggest week of the season

author: John Cross
title: Arsenal stars call team meeting to try to fix things before biggest week of the season
text:
Sport Arsenal stars call team meeting to try to fix things before biggest week of the season The atmosphere is downbeat with the title surely gone for another year after back-to-back losses, massive Bayern Munich tie days away, fan unrest obvious and the futures of Wenger and Sanchez up in the air Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Craig Burley: Arsenal fans are spineless Share this video Get Arsenal FC     
Arsene Wenger is facing a make-or-break week which could shape Arsenal ’s whole future. 
The Gunners' players have held a team meeting as they try to stop the season disintegrating. 
Boss Wenger ’s own position has come under the spotlight, and they face improving Hull at the Emirates on Saturday before travelling to Bayern Munich four days later — a Champions League last-16 first leg tie which has become the club’s biggest game of the season. 
Back-to-back defeats at home to Watford and at leaders Chelsea in little more than three days have left them 12 points off top spot with 14 games to go and it has become, once again, a battle to finish in the top four. 
The players are determined to get the season back on track and hope that post-game debrief on Tuesday will act as a rallying cry ahead of two huge fixtures. Banned Wenger has had to watch the Watford and Chelsea losses from the stand (Photo: Reuters) 
Mesut Ozil’s recent form has been a major concern, with the Germany midfielder struggling to return to his standards of earlier in the season. 
Alexis Sanchez, the Gunners' other star, was clearly frustrated after the defeat at Chelsea and the atmosphere at the training ground has been downbeat. 
Mirror Sport understands even the players and coaching staff have no idea whether Wenger is going to stay on, with his £8m-a-year contract due to expire at the end of the season. 
There is a two-year contract on the table and Wenger has confirmed he will make a decision on his future based on the mood around the club and the fans. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Arsenal fan defends anti-Wenger banner Share this video Watch Next 
It had seemed certain he would re-sign, but it is understood he has become increasingly aware of the fan backlash and that has raised serious doubts over whether he will end his 20-year reign. 
Club insiders believe the unrest among the supporters has been worse than this in the past and that this week’s fall-out has exploded on the back of two bad results. They hope a good run will quickly change the mood. 
But it is clear they will have to keep an open mind on Wenger’s future if the 67-year-old Frenchman does decide to go. 
Borussia Dortmund boss Thomas Tuchel, Bayer Leverkusen’s Roger Schmidt and Monaco coach Leonardo Jardim could all be potential contenders. Tuchel would be in the frame if Wenger does leave (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Read More 
Max Allegri of Juventus is also believed to fancy the job should it become available but it remains more likely that Wenger will stay. 
The other worry for Arsenal is the futures of Ozil and Sanchez. 
Arsenal remain more confident that Ozil will commit himself to a new contract. But there is a growing belief at Paris Saint-Germain that they will be able to lure Sanchez to the French capital this summer. 
PSG are also interested in prolific Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero, but Sanchez is their No1 priority and they are growing in confidence because the Gunners are still a long way from agreeing terms with the Chilean forward. Sanchez looked thoroughly cheesed off after the loss at Chelsea (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Read More Arsenal's Mustafi claims they CAN still catch Chelsea and win the title 
Sanchez is currently on £130,000-a-week. Arsenal have offered another £50k on top of that, but he wants a rise to in excess of £1million per month. 
There have been overtures from China, Italian champions Juventus and Spanish heavyweights Atletico Madrid, but PSG would appear to be in pole position. 
Arsenal are sweating on whether right-back Hector Bellerin will be available to face Hull on Saturday after his concussion against Chelsea. 
Midfielder Francis Coquelin has also been nursing a hamstring problem, but Mohamed Elneny is now back from Africa Cup of Nations duty with Egypt to provide an option there. poll loading Who will advance to the Champions League quarter-finals? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
